ygData.subject: basic help needed
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, First, I am not a computer (or programming) expert, and am new to Cantera.  So, I might have some silly questions I need help with. Let s start here: I

Hi,

First, I am not a computer (or programming) expert, and am new to 
Cantera.  So, I might have some silly questions I need help with.

Let's start here:

I think I can have the Python module read my input file with this 
code:

from Cantera import*
gas=importPhase('HgCl2rxn.txt')
print gas

This is all I have, because I am learning how to use this.

The file HgCl2rxn.txt is:

ideal_gas(name = 'reactants_gas',elements = 'Hg Cl',species = 'Hg Cl2 
HgCl2',initial_state = state(temperature = 415.15,pressure = 
(1.0, 'atm'),mole_fractions = 'Hg:.5, Cl2:.5, HgCl2:0.0'),
          reactions = 'all')

species(name = 'HgCl2',atoms = 'Hg:1 Cl:2',thermo = Shomate([298.0, 
673.15],[68.10715, 25.82377, -4.640057,.361514, -.132167, -251.976,
218.6784]))

species(name = 'Hg_gas',atoms = 'Hg:1',thermo = Shomate([298.0, 
673.15],[20.67243, .179353, -.08012, .010547,07013, 55.23215, 
199.9797]))

species(name = 'Cl2_gas',atoms = 'Cl:2',thermo = Shomate([298.0, 
1000],[33.05060, 12.2294, -12.0651, 4.38533,-.159494, -10.8348, 
259.029]))

Now I get this reply from the module:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./.cttmp.py", line 8, in ?
    execfile(file)
  File "C:\Program Files\Common Files/Cantera/data/HgCl2rxn.txt", 
line 22
    
                                ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

  File "./.cttmp.py", line 8, in ?
    execfile(file)
  File "C:\Program Files\Common Files/Cantera/data/HgCl2rxn.txt", 
line 10, in ?
    species(name = 'HgCl2',atoms = 'Hg:1 Cl:2',thermo = Shomate
([298.0, 673.15],[68.10715, 25.82377, -4.640057,
NameError: name 'Shomate' is not defined
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./.cttmp.py", line 8, in ?
    execfile(file)
  File "C:\Program Files\Common Files/Cantera/data/HgCl2rxn.txt", 
line 10, in ?

([298.0, 673.15],[68.10715, 25.82377, -4.640057,
NameError: name 'Shomate' is not defined

  File "./HgCl2rxn.txt", line 10, in ?

([298.0, 673.15],[68.10715, 25.82377, -4.640057,
NameError: name 'Shomate' is not defined

Exception exceptions.AttributeError: "XML_Node instance has no 
attribute '_xml_id'" in Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:/Documents and Settings/Dalton York/Desktop/HgCl2rxn.py", 
line 9, in ?
    gas=importPhase('HgCl2rxn.txt')
  File "C:\Python23\lib\site-packages\Cantera\importFromFile.py", 
line 6, in importPhase
    return importPhases(file, [name])[0]
  File "C:\Python23\lib\site-packages\Cantera\importFromFile.py", 
line 13, in importPhases
    s.append(solution.Solution(src=file,id=nm))
  File "C:\Python23\lib\site-packages\Cantera\solution.py", line 49, 
in __init__
    ThermoPhase.__init__(self, xml_phase=s)
  File "C:\Python23\lib\site-packages\Cantera\ThermoPhase.py", line 
39, in __init__
    self._phase_id = _cantera.ThermoFromXML(xml_phase._xml_id)
error: 
Procedure: SpeciesThermoFactory::newSpeciesThermo
Error:   Specified species parameterization type (0) does not match 
any known type.

Hopefully, this is not too much at once.  

As you see, it states that "Shomate" is not a valid directive.  It 
gives me basically the same response if I comment out all 
the "species" declarations and just try to read in the ideal_gas 
phase declaration.  So, why does it not recognize "Shomate" (and why 
does it even rad it when I comment out the species declarations?)

Hopefully, someone out there has time to help me with such a basic 
problem.  I greatly appreciate it in advance.

Dalton York
University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
